body: This change is a bit funky.  It's only necessary when running in an asynchronous subshell, but should be slightly faster in general anyway.  Without this, loading in the background with a tool like `Zinit` causes some kind of problem related to either the cd or the quoting, honestly I failed to trace it to the final cause, but this works around it.
title: spack setup-env.sh: make zsh loading async compatible, and ~10x faster (in some cases)
